Mar 03, 2023 9:00:17 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
anyway you misunderstood my meaning of 'perfect', what i meant (as i said before) was that fujimoto intended for it to be this way in the first place with the many possible interpretations, and imo it was a perfect execution of his intention, i wouldn't want any part of it changed
Mar 03, 2023 8:57:36 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
if we're speaking in terms of cognitive functions, ni and ne are definitely very flexible hahah
Mar 03, 2023 8:56:18 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
i also enjoy the fact that there are so many different interpretations of this piece, and i also like connecting all these possible interpretations together to get at the true overarching intention
Mar 03, 2023 8:55:46 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov

Mar 03, 2023 8:54:56 pm

Mar 03, 2023 8:54:22 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov

Mar 03, 2023 8:53:53 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov

Mar 03, 2023 8:53:48 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov

Mar 03, 2023 8:53:14 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
and he just can't get it right, something is always missing, bc if he can't come to terms with their death then he can't come to terms with the meaning of their life
Mar 03, 2023 8:52:33 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
i'd also add that i think in this case, mc is almost afraid of looking his own art in the eyes ? like i see the whole cutting and recutting thing as his anxiety over the fact that he holds the power to decide how this person and their life will be remembered ?
Mar 03, 2023 8:51:38 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov

Mar 03, 2023 8:49:39 pm

Mar 03, 2023 5:49:48 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
"Surrealism is a literary and artistic movement in which the goal is to create something bizarre and disjointed, but still somehow understandable. Surrealist paintings and novels often have a dreamlike quality ‚Äì they sort of make sense, but they‚Äôre extremely bizarre and hard to follow."
  • ‚ù§Juniper Dew (Mar 04, 2023 1:51:14 am)
Mar 03, 2023 5:49:38 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
"Surrealism in literature can be defined as an artistic attempt to bridge together reality and the imagination. Surrealists seek to overcome the contradictions of the conscious and unconscious minds by creating unreal or bizarre stories full of juxtapositions."
Mar 03, 2023 5:49:01 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
goodbye eri doesnt quite make it into the magical realism genre but i would argue that this still applies bc that same intention of exploring themes with a classically surrealist approach is still there
  • ‚ù§Juniper Dew (Mar 04, 2023 1:50:55 am)
Mar 03, 2023 5:48:13 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
This message was unsent
Mar 03, 2023 5:45:55 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
from an article on murakami: "Magical realism is arguably the main hallmark of Murakami's work as both a stylistic storytelling device and his main tool for exploring the majority of the common themes mentioned in this list. Without the surreal aspects introduced through magical realism, his mundane characters couldn't embark on their surreal adventures. And without this, his examinations of individualism and identity just wouldn't be the same."
  • ‚ù§Juniper Dew (Mar 04, 2023 1:50:48 am)
Mar 03, 2023 5:43:57 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
"People say my books are weird, but beyond the weirdness, there should be a better world. It‚Äôs just that we have to experience the weirdness before we get to the better world. That‚Äôs the fundamental structure of my stories: you have to go through the darkness, through the underground, before you get to the light."
  • ‚ù§Juniper Dew (Mar 04, 2023 1:50:44 am)

Livinia Xia-Bednikov

Mar 03, 2023 5:42:32 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov

Mar 03, 2023 5:34:55 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
so whilst both functions can do both 'sticking to one path' and 'exploring interpretations', ni's strength is the former bc it sees that deep recurring theme/pattern that can be used to explain all the data, whereas ne's strength is in the latter bc it uses their subjective perceptions of reality to springboard into other possibilities
  • ‚ù§Juniper Dew (Mar 04, 2023 1:50:08 am)
Mar 03, 2023 5:34:37 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
yeah its an oversimplification on my part, but basically ne is divergent processing, it takes a single point of reality and branches off into many possible subjective perceptions of how reality could be, whereas ne is convergent processing, it subconsciously absorbs and processes information from reality and grasps overarching themes and universal concepts
Mar 03, 2023 5:32:44 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
even the fact that we're debating abt it now like this is proof for me that he's created something incredible
Mar 03, 2023 5:27:49 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
so yeah what i mean by 'perfect' is that he executed a story that does exactly what he meant for it to do, and his intention really resonates with me
  • ‚ù§Juniper Dew (Mar 04, 2023 1:49:22 am)

Mar 01, 2023 7:42:05 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
okay first off thank you for opening up about this, i'm proud of you! it's definitely not easy to put these kinds of things into words, let alone present those words to someone else to read knowing that it's giving them a part of your insides. i think at the root of all this is sort of this desire to be needed and appreciated by other people? it's so wonderful that you're such a giving person, but when it's unhealthy this is definitely the sort of thing that would just eat you up over time especially when you don't feel able to let other people be needed by you? you said that it's selfish and i understand exactly what you mean, although i'm not sure if selfish is the right word for it? it's a hard pill to swallow, but i think a lot of people have to work at accepting the fact that you can't always be the giver, it's not Romantic or beautiful, it's actually something that can destroy you from the inside and can also be disrespectful to other people? i don't feel upset by anything you've said btw, but if it helps you to imagine the other person's perspective, then think about how being opened up to is also a gift of friendship. 'giving' doesn't just mean being there all the time for their problems and trying to be the shoulder they always go to to lean on, bc if it's like that then it's not healthy for EITHER of the people involved. it disrespects everyone in the friendship. instead, we can try to think about 'giving' in different ways! being opened up to, being leaned on, they're all very special feelings that come from friendship and being gifted the privilege of being someone else's 'person to turn to', 'shoulder to lean on', and such... these are also wonderful to receive. there are many ways to 'give' and trapping yourself into thinking that the only way to give is to constantly cut out pieces of yourself and patch up other people is only going to hurt you AND them. bc not everyone wants that, not everyone would actually feel good being on the receiving end of that type of giving all the time, especially when it's not mutual. anyway, i think deep down you really do crave being on the receiving side of something like that (as everyone does) except you're not allowing yourself to be? it's like on one level you want to be supported and you want someone to see all your pain and suffering, but on another level you're actively trying to convince yourself and everyone around you that you don't think you deserve it, even though you actually believe you do deep down. it's not what your 'brain is aching irrationally for', it's actually what you do desire and you brain is trying to patch it up with excuses, i feel like it's actually working the other way around if that makes sense. i think that it's important that you try to decipher why it is that you have this mechanism?
  • ‚ù§Juniper Dew (Mar 01, 2023 7:43:13 pm)

Juniper Dew
Seven:
- bubbly on the outside
- shows hints of darkness amidst humour and positivity
- tech
- wishes he had someone to share what he's feeling with
- persona so he doesn't have people get properly close to him, because he'd have to push them away
- doesn't believe he deserves to do things outside a specific set of things
- takes on too much work to distract himself
Mar 01, 2023 5:13:27 pm
Juniper Dew
V:
- art
- self sacrificing
- punishes himself when he can't resolve other's problems, or causes them harm
- will do anything for the one he loves
- is blind to letting go

Feb 23, 2023 5:29:40 pm

I hope that made sense
Feb 23, 2023 5:29:32 pm
Juniper Dew
so yes as we develop further, 'mystical culture' fades, yes, but there is still opportunities for 'contemporary culture' to be made.
by contemporary culture I mean a collective consciousness within a community, based on their reactions to what they know, believe, and feel about said information.

and yeah, 'contemporary culture' is a lot less exciting and diverse than 'mystical culture', because the latter involves so many more "what ifs" and unknowns that it naturally breeds more variety and creativity
  • ‚ù§Livinia Xia-Bednikov (Feb 23, 2023 6:54:08 pm)
Feb 23, 2023 5:29:28 pm
Juniper Dew
humanity's progress in the realms of science and technology are replacing mysticism üôè very much agreed.
whilst your definition of culture fades, what we do with such sci/tech information and people's attitudes/reactions to it are what shape a society's 'new' culture. which is very much different to the 'old' culture born from mysticism, yes, but even that was just reacting to what we had around us and trying to explain it with the means we had
  • ‚ù§Livinia Xia-Bednikov (Feb 23, 2023 6:53:59 pm)
Feb 23, 2023 5:25:36 pm
Juniper Dew
a baseline has to exist for a culture to properly form üôè agreed

Livinia Xia-Bednikov
Back when we lived in mechanical solidarity, when we couldn't explain the sun and the stars and the trees and so we made up wonderful stories for them, when we first developed writing and language that was quintessentially a product of who we were as people, when we were forced to make do with what we could get out of the land and so all foods were inherently tied to the place they originated from
  • ‚ù§Juniper Dew (Feb 21, 2023 9:17:59 pm)

  • ‚ù§Livinia Xia-Bednikov (Feb 20, 2023 4:11:33 pm)

https://archive.md/VbwGB#selection-855.0-879.94
but i'd highly rec. the article ^^
Play/Pause ButtonIllustration by Vivek ThakkerAnnals of TechnologyChatGPT Is a Blurry JPEG of the WebOpenAI‚Äôs chatbot offers paraphrases, whereas Google offers quotes. Which do we prefer?By Ted ChiangFebruary 9, 20230%‚ÄÉ10%‚ÄÉ20%‚ÄÉ30%‚ÄÉ40%‚ÄÉ50%‚ÄÉ60%‚ÄÉ70%‚ÄÉ80%‚ÄÉ90%‚ÄÉ100%
https://archive.md/VbwGB
Feb 10, 2023 11:48:40 pm
Juniper Dew
here is the gist:
What I‚Äôve described sounds a lot like ChatGPT, or most any other large-language model. Think of ChatGPT as a blurry JPEG of all the text on the Web. It retains much of the information on the Web, in the same way that a JPEG retains much of the information of a higher-resolution image, but, if you‚Äôre looking for an exact sequence of bits, you won‚Äôt find it; all you will ever get is an approximation. But, because the approximation is presented in the form of grammatical text, which ChatGPT excels at creating, it‚Äôs usually acceptable. You‚Äôre still looking at a blurry JPEG, but the blurriness occurs in a way that doesn‚Äôt make the picture as a whole look less sharp.

Livinia Xia-Bednikov
My dad: stubborn af, sees the world in black and white, thinks he knows best and everyone should live in his world, thinks yelling the loudest means he's the most convincing, is always right

My mum: latches onto the flaws in my dads point of view and refuses to let go, nags endlessly (gets on a roll with it), brings up already resolved problems from the past as an argument

Me: pretends to be chill so as to claim the moral upper ground, actually stubborn and enjoys logically destroying people, refuses to be wrong, has to have the last word

My sister: intense mood swings, hates being told she's wrong, takes everything personally, refuses to do what people tell her to even if it's for her own good, arguments have no logic and just consist of insults

Sep 16, 2022 5:03:52 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
Whereas if you're constantly introducing spontaneity into your life then ur brain has to constantly make new pathways and you feel time goes by slower and it feels richer
  • ‚ù§Juniper Dew (Sep 18, 2022 10:08:28 am)
Sep 16, 2022 5:03:44 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
So you actually experience time as going by faster bc it doesn't take as much mental energy to do that
Sep 16, 2022 5:03:12 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
And the things that are in your routine just use the same pathways every time
Sep 16, 2022 5:02:49 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
Bc your brain makes neural pathways and connections for everything
Sep 16, 2022 5:02:30 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
Having a strict routine actually makes your life feel shorter
Sep 16, 2022 5:02:12 pm
Livinia Xia-Bednikov
Facts...routine is so comfy but so scary

Juniper Dew
bad not seeming as bad and good seeming better, brain making things easier for you when reflecting?
cognitive dissonance - values not aligning with what you actually do, brain tries to ease feeling of conflict. focusing on the good parts to justify what you're doing. people doing considerate things without asking... I feel that, being on the fringes all the time. felt that a lot with Ellie. I don't think you shouldn't feel sad at all. sitting for 3 hours without talking to consider a good friend YES!?!?!!?!? feeling that bit about never getting married, on a different level - meeting too many people and never fully being able to share myself with someone
